Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a TCP proxy server class that can forward traffic between a client and a remote server, with the ability to start, stop, and manage connections dynamically.

Class Description: The ConnectionManipulationProxyServer class acts as a TCP proxy that listens on a local port, accepts client connections, and forwards traffic to a specified remote host and port. It provides thread-safe control over the proxy's operation and proper resource cleanup.

Attributes:
- localPort: [int] - The local port on which the proxy listens for client connections
- host: [String] - The remote host address to which traffic will be forwarded
- remotePort: [int] - The remote port to which traffic will be forwarded
- proxyThread: [Thread] - The thread running the proxy operation
- enableLock: [Object] - Synchronization lock for thread-safe operation control
- enableProxy: [boolean] - Flag indicating whether the proxy is currently enabled
- running: [boolean] - Flag indicating whether the proxy thread should continue running
- client: [Socket] - The client-side socket connection
- server: [Socket] - The server-side socket connection
- serverSocket: [ServerSocket] - The server socket listening for client connections

Methods:
- ConnectionManipulationProxyServer([String host, int remotePort, int localPort]) -> [void] - Constructor that initializes the proxy with target host and port information
- startProxy() -> [void] - Starts the proxy server thread and enables traffic forwarding
- stopProxy() -> [void] - Stops the proxy server thread and disables traffic forwarding
- killOpenSockets() -> [void] - Closes all open sockets and cleans up resources
- run() -> [void] - Main proxy thread execution method that handles connection setup and data forwarding
- getLocalPort() -> [int] - Returns the local port on which the proxy is listening
